text: Hyman G. Rickover (January 27, 1900 â€“ July 8, 1986) was an Admiral in the U.S. Navy. He helped create nuclear powered submarines. He was director of the U.S. Naval Reactors office. Rickover is also one of four people who have been awarded two Congressional Gold Medals. ==References== Category:1900 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Polish military people Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Presidential Medal of Freedom recipients Category:Congressional Gold Medal recipients
title: Hyman G. Rickover
